messages.content:
welcome to the pod everyone!! ðŸŒ¿

so excited you're all here. I'm Sarah - your coach for this journey

quick things:
some of you are further along than others and that's actually perfect. you learn from the ones ahead and help the ones behind you

introduce yourself when you get a chance! tell us what brought you to functional medicine ðŸ’•

omg welcome!! ðŸŽ‰

so happy you're here. I started like 6 weeks ago and honestly it's been the best decision

this group is seriously the best and Sarah actually responds to everything which is rare lol

what made you decide to start?

welcome!! ðŸ’•

one thing that helped me - don't try to rush through everything. I know it's tempting lol but the info really builds on itself so taking your time actually helps

also everyone here is super supportive. whenever I got confused about something I just asked and someone always helped

hi!! welcome!

honestly I was kinda nervous at first because I wasn't sure if I could actually do this? but everyone here is so nice and Sarah explains stuff in a way that actually clicks

what part of functional medicine interests you most? I'm really into the gut health stuff so far it's fascinating

hey! welcome ðŸŒ¸

what brought you here?

welcome!! ðŸŽ‰

the certification is really thorough and Sarah genuinely cares about us which you can tell

can't wait to see your journey! we're all cheering for you ðŸ’•

everyone jumping in to welcome our newest member... this is exactly why this community works

let's do this together ðŸ’•

so I just finished the first lesson on the foundations of integrative health and wow

like I thought I knew what functional medicine was but they explain it so differently here? the whole thing about treating root causes vs symptoms finally clicked for me

anyone else have that "ohhhh" moment in the first module?

yes!! that's exactly how I felt

the part about how your body is all connected and not just separate organs doing their own thing... that changed everything for me

it only gets better from here trust me

quick question - does anyone take notes while watching or just rewatch sections that are confusing?

I'm trying to figure out the best way to actually retain all this info

great question Cheryl! honestly everyone learns differently

some of my most successful students just do one lesson at a time and let it sink in overnight before moving on. the quizzes help reinforce things too!

pro tip: the downloadable worksheets are gold - print them out if you can ðŸ“

ok I'm finally catching up... took me a bit longer to start but I finished orientation!

feeling better about this now ðŸ˜…

yay Lisa!! ðŸŽ‰ that's awesome! don't worry about the pace - everyone goes at different speeds

I was slower at first too and then it picked up when things started connecting

just hit 15% progress today! the gut health preview in the foundations module has me SO excited for that full module

I can already think of like 5 people who need this information ðŸ˜‚

ok so the assessment module is actually really practical?? like I was expecting boring forms but this is stuff I can actually USE

the health history questions are so much more thorough than anything I've seen from regular doctors

right?! I did the assessment on myself and it was eye-opening

realized some patterns I never connected before... like my energy crashes and what I eat for breakfast ðŸ¤¯

this is EXACTLY what I love to hear! ðŸ’•

the assessment tools are designed to find those connections that conventional medicine misses. once you start seeing patterns, you can't unsee them

and yes - try them on yourself first! you'll be a much better practitioner when you've experienced the process

happy weekend everyone! ðŸŒŸ

going to try to finish the ethics module today. anyone else studying this weekend?
me!! I have a few hours today so going to power through. want to hit 25% by Monday ðŸ’ª

taking it easy today but will do some review. my brain needs a break lol

but honestly even just reviewing my notes is helping things stick better

love seeing both the grinders AND the resters! both approaches work ðŸ˜Š

rest is part of learning - your brain consolidates info while you sleep and relax. so Lisa you're literally still learning even on your break day!

ONE WEEK IN!! ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰ðŸŽ‰

so proud of everyone for showing up! this first week is always the hardest - you're building new habits and learning a completely new approach to health

quick check: how's everyone feeling? any questions or things you're stuck on?

feeling great! at 28% now and the functional nutrition module is ðŸ”¥

so much good info about macros and timing. already changed how I eat!

honestly feeling so grateful I found this. the support here is incredible

I've tried other online courses before and they were so isolating. this feels completely different
question about the gut health module - should I finish the nutrition one first or can I jump ahead? I'm SO curious about the microbiome stuff

Cheryl you can definitely peek ahead! but the nutrition module does set up some important context for gut health

my suggestion: finish nutrition this week, then gut health will make even MORE sense. it's worth the wait I promise! ðŸŒ¿

OK the gut health module is EVERYTHING ðŸ¤¯ðŸ¤¯ðŸ¤¯

the microbiome stuff... I had no idea our gut bacteria affects THAT much. mood, immunity, weight, skin... it's all connected

I'm going to be that annoying person who talks about probiotics at every dinner party now ðŸ˜‚

hahaha same!! my husband is already tired of hearing about it ðŸ˜‚

but seriously the leaky gut explanation finally made sense to me. I've heard that term for years but never understood what it actually means

you're not annoying Cheryl - you're educated! ðŸ’ª

this is exactly why functional medicine is so powerful. when you understand HOW the body works, you can actually help people instead of just managing symptoms

the gut module is usually when students have their biggest "aha" moments. sounds like you're right on track!
